instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message:
I have an A1534 820-00045 that has no power. It has 5V on amp meter,but pulls 0A.

I have 5.2V on PPDCIN_E85_SS
PPDCIN_G3H = 5.2V
PP3V3_G3H = 0V
PP3V3R3V0_AON = 0V

I'm looking for the CD3215A but can't find it on this board, and not even sure if that's relevant in this case...

Can you help?

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message:
This model doesn't use CD3215 chip.
U4700/80 are known as common failure.
Check diode mode to ground on  PP3V3R3V0_AON .

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message:
I've replaced U4700 and 4780 but without success.
PP3V3_G3H  = 0V and  PP3V3R3V0_AON = 0V . None is shorted.

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message: Actual diode mode to ground at  PP3V3R3V0_AON?

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message:
Looks still too low.
Could be U7100, or other chip connected there.
Continue with U4400 and U4650.

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message:
HI,
I've replaced U7100, U4400 and U4650, but same result.
Any more ideas?

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message:
Check again that diode mode reading.
Should be higher than 400; compare with other board.

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I have 0.340mV. Don´t have any other board of this model to compare. 
Do you think that this diode value isen't OK?

threads.title: A1534 820-00045 no power
threads.message:
LogiWiki webpage may have some readings.
Also Louis should have some video about this board.
